rationale: The architecture is useful and can be implemented safely as a staged research workflow, but evidence is insufficient for immediate production rollout. Efficiency claims are assumption-heavy, and empirical validation lacks robust numeric ablations and broad market coverage.
rejection_reasons: Reject immediate full-production deployment because assumptions behind theoretical guarantees are not validated for the target trading regime.
Reject direct strategy promotion because experiments are narrow (single market/year) and mainly directional in reported results.
Reject live-capital usage without stronger backtest realism controls (costs, slippage, turnover, robustness).
recommendations: Implement the two-loop architecture in shadow mode with full artifact capture and deterministic replay metadata.
Add strict promotion gates: walk-forward robustness, cost-aware performance, turnover and drawdown limits.
Introduce KB governance: provenance hashes, deduplication, retirement/decay of stale patterns.
Run ablations for inner-loop only, outer-loop only, and full loop to verify incremental benefit in-house.
Require human approval for any transition from paper trading to live execution.
